question: A metallic sphere of radius R carrying a charge q is kept at certain distance from another metallic sphere of radius R/4 carrying a charge Q. What is the electric flux at any point inside the metallic sphere of radius R due to the sphere of radius $R/4$?
images/b8c9d0e1-f2a3-4b4c-5d6e-7f8a9b0c1d2e.png
explanation: Inside a metallic conductor (electrostatic equilibrium), the net electric field is zero due to electrostatic shielding.
Therefore, the flux contribution inside the metal of the first sphere is zero.
